metrics.name: Late payment rate
metrics.description: Percentage of cases with late payments. Only cases that are paid are considered.
metrics.signalFragment:
COUNT(case_id) FILTER (
	WHERE (${late_payment_condition})
	)
/ COUNT(case_id) FILTER (
	WHERE (${invoice_clearing_date} IS NOT NULL)
	)
* 100

metricsVariables.name: late_payment_condition
metricsVariables.description: Condition that identifies cases with invoices paid late, for example "Last FI Invoice Item Due Date" < "Last FI Invoice Item Clearing Date"
metricsVariables.value: "Last FI Invoice Item Due Date" < "Last FI Invoice Item Clearing Date"

metricsVariables.name: invoice_clearing_date
metricsVariables.description: Attribute referring to the clearing date of an invoice, for example "Last FI Invoice Item Clearing Date"

processVariables.name: Last FI Invoice Item Gross Amount in USD
processVariables.displayName: Last FI Invoice Item Gross Amount in USD

blocks.text: This dashboard provides an overview and details on delayed payments.

Structure of the Dashboard
  Page 1 - Overview: Leading KPIs, a Process Discovery Widget and a Business Case Calculator
Page 2 - Impact: Overview of all Late Payments in the current data set and their impact on your PTP process
Page 3 - Root Causes: Deep Dive into drivers of Late Payments
Page 4 - Take Action: A collection of ideas to tackle the drivers of inefficiencies
Page 5 - Case Details: An exportable list of single invoices and their most important attributes that can be filtered.
Please see our Dashboard Documentation for more information on how to manage your dashboards.
Kindly provide feedback on the Dashboard, this will aid us in enhancing its functionality.

dataSource.query:
SELECT SUM("Last FI Invoice Item Gross Amount in USD") FILTER (
	WHERE ("Last FI Invoice Item Due Date" < "Last FI Invoice Item Clearing Date")
	)
FROM THIS_PROCESS

	WHERE ("Last FI Invoice Item Due Date" < "Last FI Invoice Item Clearing Date")

parameter.name: Last FI Invoice Item Gross Amount in USD

dataSource.query:
SELECT COUNT("Last FI Invoice ID") FILTER (
	WHERE ("Last FI Invoice Item Due Date" < "Last FI Invoice Item Clearing Date")
	)
FROM THIS_PROCESS

SELECT 
"PO Vendor Name" AS "Vendor Name"
,SUM((("PO Item Total Invoiced Net Amount in USD") * ("Last FI Invoice Item Cash Discount Percentage 1"))
	-("Last FI Invoice Cash Discount in USD")) AS "Missed Cash Discounts in $"
,SUM ("Last FI Invoice Item Gross Amount in USD") AS "Invoice Amount in $"

FROM "THIS_PROCESS"
WHERE ("Last FI Invoice Item Due Date" < "Last FI Invoice Item Clearing Date") 
GROUP BY 1
ORDER BY 2 DESC

SELECT 
"PO Company Name" AS "Company Code"
,SUM ("Last FI Invoice Item Gross Amount in USD") AS "Invoice Amount in $"
,COUNT("Last FI Invoice ID") AS "No. of Invoices"
FROM "THIS_PROCESS"
WHERE ("Last FI Invoice Item Due Date" < "Last FI Invoice Item Clearing Date") 
GROUP BY 1
ORDER BY 2 DESC

blocks.text:
Definition:
Payments are considered as late when the clearing of the invoice happens after the due date of the invoice item. The following two dates are compared: 
"Last FI Invoice Item Due Date" < "Last FI Invoice Item Clearing Date"

children.name: Late Payments Overview, sorted by Invoice Amount

dataSource.query:
SELECT 
"PO Vendor Name"
,"PO Company Name"
,"PO Purchasing Group"
,"PO Type"
,"PO Item Material Group"
,"PO Item Plant Name"
,COUNT("Last FI Invoice ID") AS "No. of Invoices"
,SUM ("Last FI Invoice Item Gross Amount in USD") AS "Invoice Amount in $"
FROM "THIS_PROCESS"
WHERE ("Last FI Invoice Item Due Date" < "Last FI Invoice Item Clearing Date") 
GROUP BY 1,2,3,4,5,6
ORDER BY 8 DESC

SELECT SUM("Last FI Invoice Item Gross Amount in USD") FILTER (
	WHERE ("Last FI Invoice Item Due Date" < "Last FI Invoice Item Clearing Date")
	)
FROM THIS_PROCESS

parameter.name: Last FI Invoice Item Gross Amount in USD

blocks.text:
Potential Root Causes for Late Payments that are shown below: 
- Long Cycle Times           -  Payment Blocks           -  Too Short Sub-Cycle Times like Invoice Posting to Due-Date
- High Rework Rates        -  Manual Changes         - Low Automation of Invoice Postings

children.name: Long Sub Cycle Times causing Late Payments

dataSource.query:
SELECT
"Goods Receipt to Invoice Receipt - Cycle Time Range"
,"Avg. Total Cycle Time"
,"No. of Invoices"
,"Invoice Amount in $"
,"Late Payment Rate in %"

FROM
	(SELECT
	  CASE
	  WHEN "CYCLE_TIME" <= DURATION '5days'THEN '0 - 5 Days'
	  WHEN "CYCLE_TIME" > DURATION '5days' AND "CYCLE_TIME" <= DURATION '10days' THEN '5 - 10 Days'
	  WHEN "CYCLE_TIME" > DURATION '10days' AND "CYCLE_TIME" <= DURATION '20days' THEN '11 - 20 Days'
	  WHEN "CYCLE_TIME" > DURATION '20days' AND "CYCLE_TIME" < DURATION '30days' THEN '21 - 30 Days'
	  WHEN "CYCLE_TIME" > DURATION '30days' AND "CYCLE_TIME" < DURATION '40days' THEN '31 - 40 Days'
	  WHEN "CYCLE_TIME" > DURATION '40days' THEN 'More than 40 Days'
	  ELSE 'No Goods Receipt'
	  END AS "Goods Receipt to Invoice Receipt - Cycle Time Range"
	  ,CASE
	  WHEN "CYCLE_TIME" <= DURATION '5days'THEN 1
	  WHEN "CYCLE_TIME" > DURATION '5days' AND "CYCLE_TIME" <= DURATION '10days' THEN 2
	  WHEN "CYCLE_TIME" > DURATION '10days' AND "CYCLE_TIME" <= DURATION '20days' THEN 3
	  WHEN "CYCLE_TIME" > DURATION '20days' AND "CYCLE_TIME" < DURATION '30days' THEN 4
	  WHEN "CYCLE_TIME" > DURATION '30days' AND "CYCLE_TIME" < DURATION '40days' THEN 5
	  WHEN "CYCLE_TIME" > DURATION '40days' THEN 6
	  ELSE 7
	  END AS "Sequence No"
	  ,AVG("Total Cycle Time") AS "Avg. Total Cycle Time"
	  ,COUNT("Last FI Invoice ID") AS "No. of Invoices"
	  ,SUM("Last FI Invoice Item Gross Amount in USD") AS "Invoice Amount in $"
	  ,COUNT("Last FI Invoice ID") FILTER(WHERE ("Last FI Invoice Item Due Date" < "Last FI Invoice Item Clearing Date"))/ COUNT("Last FI Invoice ID") FILTER (WHERE ("Last FI Invoice Item Clearing Date" IS NOT NULL))* 100 AS "Late Payment Rate in %"

	  FROM
		  (SELECT DISTINCT
			 (SELECT LAST(END_TIME) WHERE EVENT_NAME = 'Create FI Invoice') - (SELECT LAST(END_TIME) WHERE EVENT_NAME = 'Create Goods Receipt') AS CYCLE_TIME
			 -- (SELECT LAST(END_TIME) WHERE EVENT_NAME = 'Clear Invoice') - (SELECT LAST(END_TIME) WHERE EVENT_NAME = 'Create FI Invoice') AS CYCLE_TIME
             --"Last FI Invoice Posting Date" - "Last FI Invoice Receipt Date" AS CYCLE_TIME
             ,((SELECT LAST (END_TIME)) - (SELECT FIRST (END_TIME))) AS "Total Cycle Time"
			 ,"Last FI Invoice ID"
			 ,"Last FI Invoice Item Gross Amount in USD"
			 ,"Last FI Invoice Item Due Date"
			 ,"Last FI Invoice Item Clearing Date"
		   FROM "THIS_PROCESS"
		   WHERE (SELECT LAST(END_TIME) WHERE EVENT_NAME = 'Clear Invoice') IS NOT NULL-- condition to make sure only cases with Invoice clearings are analysed
           --AND (SELECT LAST(END_TIME) WHERE EVENT_NAME = 'Create FI Invoice') - (SELECT LAST(END_TIME) WHERE EVENT_NAME = 'Create Goods Receipt') IS NOT NULL
		  ) AS SUB1
		  GROUP BY 1,2
		  ORDER BY 2
	) AS SUB2

children.name: Process Inefficiencies leading to Late Payments

dataSource.query:
SELECT
"PO Company Name"
,"Invoice Amount in $"
,"No. of Invoices"
,"Ø Payment Block Rate in %"
,"Ø days posting to due date"
,"Automatic Invoice Posting in %"
,"Rework Rate in %"
,"Change Rate in %"
,"Late Payment Rate in %"
-- not used:
--,"Ø Payment Block Duration in d"
--,"Ø Total Cycle Time"
FROM
	(SELECT
	  "PO Company Name"
	  ,SUM("Last FI Invoice Item Gross Amount in USD") AS "Invoice Amount in $"    
      ,COUNT("Last FI Invoice ID") AS "No. of Invoices"
      ,AVG("Payment Block Rate") AS "Ø Payment Block Rate in %"
	  ,AVG("Last FI Invoice Item Due Date" - "Last FI Invoice Posting Date") AS "Ø days posting to due date"
      ,COUNT("Last FI Invoice ID") FILTER(WHERE "Event Created By User Type" MATCHES ('System') AND event_name MATCHES('Create FI Invoice'))/COUNT("Last FI Invoice ID") AS "Automatic Invoice Posting in %"
      ,COUNT("Last FI Invoice ID") FILTER (WHERE(SELECT BOOL_OR (occurrence > 1)FROM(SELECT OCCURRENCE(event_name) AS occurrence) AS sub))/COUNT("Last FI Invoice ID")*100 AS "Rework Rate in %"
	  ,COUNT("Last FI Invoice ID") FILTER(WHERE event_name MATCHES (ILIKE '%update%'))/COUNT("Last FI Invoice ID") * 100 AS "Change Rate in %"
      ,COUNT("Last FI Invoice ID") FILTER(WHERE ("Last FI Invoice Item Due Date" < "Last FI Invoice Item Clearing Date"))/ COUNT("Last FI Invoice ID") FILTER (WHERE ("Last FI Invoice Item Clearing Date" IS NOT NULL))* 100 AS "Late Payment Rate in %"
	-- not used:
	--,AVG("Payment Block Duration") AS "Ø Payment Block Duration in d"
    --,AVG("Total Cycle Time") AS "Ø Total Cycle Time"
	  FROM
		  (SELECT DISTINCT
			 "PO Company Name"
             ,COUNT("Last FI Invoice ID") FILTER (WHERE event_name MATCHES ('Remove Payment Block'))/ COUNT("Last FI Invoice ID") * 100 AS "Payment Block Rate" 
			 ,"Last FI Invoice ID"
			 ,"Last FI Invoice Item Gross Amount in USD"
			 ,"Last FI Invoice Item Due Date"
			 ,"Last FI Invoice Item Clearing Date"
             ,"Last FI Invoice Posting Date"
             ,"Event Created By User Type"
             ,"event_name"
             -- not used:
			 -- ,((SELECT LAST (END_TIME)) - (SELECT FIRST (END_TIME))) AS "Total Cycle Time"
             --,(SELECT LAST(END_TIME) WHERE EVENT_NAME = 'Remove Payment Block') - (SELECT FIRST(END_TIME) WHERE EVENT_NAME = 'Set Payment Block') AS "Payment Block Duration"
		   FROM "THIS_PROCESS"
		   WHERE (SELECT LAST(END_TIME) WHERE EVENT_NAME = 'Clear Invoice') IS NOT NULL-- condition to make sure only cases with Invoice clearings are analysed
          ) AS SUB1
		  GROUP BY 1
		  ORDER BY 2 desc
	) AS SUB2

SELECT SUM("Last FI Invoice Item Gross Amount in USD") FILTER (
	WHERE ("Last FI Invoice Item Due Date" < "Last FI Invoice Item Clearing Date")
	)
FROM THIS_PROCESS

parameter.name: Last FI Invoice Item Gross Amount in USD

blocks.text: 1. Attach a number to your Business Case to visualize its impact. You can start by using the below Business Case Calculator

children.name: Suggestions to reduce/avoid late payments include:

blocks.text: Reduce long cycle times by:
Automating Invoice Creation
Automating Invoice Clearing
Automating Release of PO
Review approval times
Reduce Rework. Avoid Looping
Reduce Manual Entries
Master data should be managed well
Check which vendors could improve on and examine what good vendors are doing

children.name: Business Case Calculator
children.description: * FTE Cost / Min = ($70,000 ÷  261 days/year ÷ 8 hours/ day ÷  60 min/hr) = $0.56

dataSource.query:
SELECT
"Last FI Invoice ID" AS "Invoice Number"
,"Last FI Invoice Item Gross Amount in USD" AS "Invoice Amount in $"
,"Last FI Invoice Document Type Text" AS "Doc Type" 
,"Last FI Invoice Cash Discount in USD" AS "Cash Discount Amount"
,"Last FI Invoice Company Name" AS "Company Code" 
,"Last FI Invoice Item G/L Account Number" AS "G/L Account Number"
,"Last FI Invoice Item Profit Center" AS "Profit Center"
,"PO Vendor Name"
,"PO Vendor Number"

--  all date fields
,"Last FI Invoice Receipt Date" AS "Invoice Receipt Date"
,"Last FI Invoice Posting Date" AS "Posting Date"
,"Last FI Invoice Item Clearing Entry Date" AS "Clearing Entry Date"
,"Last FI Invoice Item Clearing Date" AS "Clearing Date"
,"Last FI Invoice Item Cash Discount 1 Due Date" AS "CD due date 1"
,"Last FI Invoice Item Cash Discount 2 Due Date" AS "CD due date 2"
,"Last FI Invoice Item Due Date" AS "Due Date"

-- aggregated KPIs
,AVG((SELECT LAST(END_TIME)) - (SELECT FIRST(END_TIME))) AS "Total Cycle Time"
,AVG("Last FI Invoice Posting Date" - "Last FI Invoice Receipt Date") AS "avg time invoice receipt to posting"
,AVG("Last FI Invoice Item Clearing Date" - "Last FI Invoice Posting Date") AS "avg time posting to clearing"
,AVG("Last FI Invoice Item Clearing Date" - "Last FI Invoice Item Due Date") AS "No. of days paid late"

FROM "THIS_PROCESS"
WHERE ("Last FI Invoice Item Due Date" < "Last FI Invoice Item Clearing Date") AND "Last FI Invoice ID" IS NOT NULL
ORDER BY 1 desc
LIMIT 100
